did.abstract: This collection includes notes and reports of Elaine Herne, Acting Assistant Principal at the Brooklyn Training School and Home for Young Girls, dating from 1933 to 1947. Notes include lists, evaluations, and assessments of students and teachers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Training School and Home for Young Girls (also known as the Protestant Problem Girls School and P.S. 401) was founded circa 1890. Until 1947, it was the only institution of its kind for Protestant girls in New York City.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes notes and reports of Elaine Herne, Acting Assistant Principal at the Brooklyn Training School and Home for Young Girls, dating from 1933 to 1947. Notes include lists, evaluations, and assessments of students and teachers.
